## HighlightOutliner.(constructor)

Construct an outliner.

**Signature:**

```typescript
constructor(boxes: Array<Object>, borderWidth?: number, innerMargin?: number, isLTR?: boolean);
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter

</th><th>

Type

</th><th>

Description

</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

boxes

</td><td>

Array&lt;Object&gt;

</td><td>

An array of axis-aligned rectangles.

</td></tr>
<tr><td>

borderWidth

</td><td>

number

</td><td>

_(Optional)_ The width of the border of the boxes, it. allows to make the boxes bigger (or smaller).

</td></tr>
<tr><td>

innerMargin

</td><td>

number

</td><td>

_(Optional)_ The margin between the boxes and the. outlines. It's important to not have a null innerMargin when we want to. draw the outline else the stroked outline could be clipped because of its. width.

</td></tr>
<tr><td>

isLTR

</td><td>

boolean

</td><td>

_(Optional)_ true if we're in LTR mode. It's used to determine. the last point of the boxes.

</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
